verses.text: 黎巴嫩哪！敞開你的門戶，好讓火吞滅你的香柏樹。
松樹啊！哀號吧，因為香柏樹已經倒下，雄壯的樹木都毀壞了；巴珊的橡樹啊！哀號吧，因為茂密的樹林被砍下來了。
聽牧人們哀號的聲音，因為他們榮美的草場毀壞了；聽少壯獅子吼叫的聲音，因為約旦河邊的叢林毀壞了。

words.note: Used here as a noun modifying 'sound'.
A descriptive compound noun referring to a strong, young lion.
Used here as a noun modifying 'sound'.

verses.text: 耶和華我的 神這樣說：「你要牧養這將被宰殺的羊群。

words.note: Refers to the singular, supreme God.

verses.text: 那些買了牠們的宰殺牠們，也不算為有罪；那些賣牠們的說：『耶和華是應當稱頌的，因我成了富足的人。』牠們的牧人並不憐恤牠們。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause ('those who bought them').
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause ('those who sold them').
Often used before 不 to emphasize negation.

verses.text: 因此我必不再憐恤這地的居民（這是耶和華的宣告）。看哪！我把他們各人交在他的鄰舍和君王的手中。他們必摧毀這地，我必不救這地的居民脫離他們的手。」

words.note: A common biblical term for showing compassion.
The Hebrew name of God, rendered 'the LORD' in many English Bibles.
An exclamation common in prophetic and poetic texts.
Introduces a direct object for emphasis or manipulation.
Combines 'to hand over' with 'at/in' for location.

verses.text: 於是，我牧養這將被宰殺的羊群，就是羊群中最困苦的；我取了兩根杖，一根我稱為「恩寵」，另一根稱為「聯合」。這樣我就牧養了羊群。

words.note: Common in the Bible for spiritual or literal shepherding.
Lit. 'gracious favor'; often refers to divine grace in the Bible.

verses.text: 在一個月之內我除滅了三個牧人。我的心厭煩他們，他們的心也討厭我。

words.note: Classical Chinese structure for 'within a certain time/scope'.

verses.text: 我就說：「我不再牧養你們了；那將要死的，讓他死吧！那將要被除滅的，讓他被除滅吧；那些餘剩的，讓他們彼此吞食對方的肉吧！」

words.note: Indicates a change of state or completion.
Expresses suggestion, command, or exclamation.

verses.text: 然後，我拿起我那根稱為「恩寵」的杖，把它折斷，表示要廢除我與萬民所立的約；

words.note: A classical and biblical term for 'all humanity'.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.
Often refers to God's covenants in the Bible.

verses.text: 那約就在當日廢除了。這樣，那些仰望我的困苦羊群，就知道這是耶和華的話。

words.note: Refers to a specific past day.
Often implies looking to a higher power.
Describes suffering and hardship.

verses.text: 我對他們說：「你們若看為美，就給我工資；不然，就算了。」於是，他們稱了三十塊銀子作我的工資。

words.note: An idiomatic expression.

verses.text: 那時，耶和華對我說：「你要把銀子丟給陶匠。」那銀子就是他們認為我應得的高價。我就拿了那三十塊銀子，在耶和華的殿裡丟給陶匠了。

words.note: Often combined with 在...裡 to mean 'in/inside'.

verses.text: 我又折斷那稱為「聯合」的另一根杖，表示要廢除猶大和以色列之間的手足之情。

words.note: Literally 'hand and foot affection,' meaning deep kinship.

verses.text: 耶和華又對我說：「你去取愚昧牧人的裝備來。

words.note: Indicates direction towards the speaker or a purpose.

verses.text: 因為我要在這地興起一個牧人；那些快要喪亡的他不看顧，失散的他不尋找，受傷的他不醫治，強壯的他不餵養，他卻要吃肥羊的肉，撕掉牠們的蹄子。

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts for pastor/shepherd.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual or eternal perishing.
牠 specifically refers to animals, unlike 他 (he) or 她 (she).

verses.text: 「那丟棄羊群的無用牧人有禍了！願刀劍落在他的膀臂和他的右眼上；願他的膀臂全然枯槁，願他的右眼完全失明！」

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts for pastor/shepherd.
An idiomatic expression meaning 'Woe to...' or 'Cursed is...'
Used as a postposition to indicate location on a surface.
